pros: Great people, inspiring work, and the company is constantly reinventing itself and working to do better, push boundaries and innovate. The travel is also a bonus.
cons: Often too many cooks in the kitchen when it comes to decision making. Some cultural issues, as with any company, but there are ongoing discussions aimed at making improvements. As well, often upper management will make asks that deeply affect the work of those below them, with too little time to pull off the impossible. This causes a lot of unnecessary stress.

pros: flexible work live balance, compensated travel,
cons: contractors treated like full time employees, high turnover, minimal room for innovation
